questions.text: Welcome to the ocean, little seal! Where would you prefer to live?

options.text: Somewhere warm, so I can enjoy basking on the rocks outside
Somewhere cold, so I can cuddle up next to my seal buddies

questions.text: It's feeding time! How do you prefer to catch your meals?

options.text: I like to dive deep and hunt for fish in the mysterious depths
I prefer to stay near the surface and catch easy prey

questions.text: Oh no, a predator is approaching! What's your instinctive reaction?

options.text: I'll quickly dive underwater and find a hiding spot
I'll alert my fellow seals and face the threat as a group

questions.text: You've discovered a new area of the ocean. What's your first impulse?

options.text: I want to explore every nook and cranny of this exciting place
I'll carefully observe from a distance before venturing further

questions.text: It's mating season in the colony. How do you approach potential partners?

options.text: I'll put on an elaborate display to attract attention
I'll be more subtle and wait for someone to approach me

questions.text: You hear an unfamiliar sound in the distance. What do you do?

options.text: I'm curious and want to investigate the source of the sound
I'm cautious and prefer to stay where it's safe

questions.text: A group of seals is playing together. How do you feel about joining in?

options.text: I'm excited to join the fun and socialize
I'd rather watch from afar or find a quiet spot to relax

questions.text: You've found a comfy spot to rest. How do you prefer to spend your downtime?

options.text: I like to stay alert and keep an eye on my surroundings
I enjoy taking long, peaceful naps without a care in the world

questions.text: A human researcher is observing the colony. What's your reaction?

options.text: I'm intrigued and might cautiously approach to investigate
I'm wary and will keep my distance from the stranger

questions.text: It's time to migrate to new waters. How do you feel about the journey?

options.text: I'm excited for the adventure and new experiences ahead
I'm a bit anxious and will miss the familiar surroundings

questions.text: You've caught more fish than you can eat. What will you do with the extra?

options.text: I'll share my bounty with other seals in the colony
I'll store it for later, just in case food becomes scarce

questions.text: A young seal seems lost and distressed. How do you respond?

options.text: I'll immediately go help and comfort the young one
I'll keep an eye on the situation but let it solve its own problems
